text: Doris Hart (June 20, 1925 - May 29, 2015) was an American tennis player. She played singles and doubles and was ranked in the world top ten from 1946 through 1955, becoming World No. 1 during 1951. She won four Australian Championships, ten French Championships, ten Wimbledon titles, and eleven U.S. Championships. In total, she had 35 Grand Slam titles before retiring in 1955. Hart was born in St. Louis, Missouri. As a child, she suffered from osteomyelitis which left her with an impaired right leg. She also attended the University of Miami. She never married or had children. Hart died on May 29, 2015 in Coral Gables, Florida. She was 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Doris Hart at the International Tennis Hall of Fame Category:1925 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American tennis players Category:Australian Open champions Category:French Open champions Category:Sportspeople from St. Louis, Missouri Category:US Open (tennis) champions Category:Wimbledon champions Category:World No. 1 tennis players
title: Doris Hart
